main event: Two luminous fire-balls and three smaller glowing objects were observed flying rapidly and maneuvering in the sky over Colorado in 1950.
interesting points: The objects were observed flying at an estimated speed of 500 miles per hour and appeared to be guided.
The smaller objects were observed circling and glowing like molten metal.
After leaving the three smaller objects, the larger objects changed direction and speed, causing them to disappear from sight almost immediately.
The observer could not determine if the objects made a quick flight within the observed limit or disappeared by rapidly climbing.
This report was submitted by Major Donald E. Keyhoe, an Intelligence Officer in Denver, Colorado.
sighted object: two luminous fire-balls and three smaller glowing objects
location: Kit Carson and Cheyenne Wells, Colorado
witnesses: Major Donald E. Keyhoe, Intelligence Officer
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
